newsitem.title: FRANCE: Algeria, BHP sign $62 mln deal.
newsitem.headline: Algeria, BHP sign $62 mln deal.

text.p: Algeria's oil state-run Sonatrach signed a $62 million deal with Australia's Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd (BHP) on Saturday for oil and gas exploration and exploitation, Algeria's official APS news agency reported.
The agreement, signed in Algiers, covers exploration and exploitation in Boukhechba area, northwest of Illizi basin, for 10 years, APS said.
Eight wells were expected to be drilled in Boukhechba area, it said.
APS said the $62 million agreement with BHP was the second of its kind concluded since Algeria liberalised its oil and gas laws in 1991 to attract foreign investors.
Earlier the agency reported that Sonatrach and the BHP had struck oil at a test well, producing an initial 5,570 barrels a day.
The discovery, the third this year, was made at a well in Bir Sif Fatima Nord in the Erg Oriental region, near the border with Libya, it said.
